business_context.business_definition: Overall satisfaction level expressed by customer during call interaction, categorized from very negative to very positive
business_context.data_quality_note: Contains some data quality issues. Filter to main 5 values for analysis.
business_context.usage_notes: PRIMARY sentiment indicator. Use COUNT with CASE WHEN, not AVG. Use LOWER() for case-insensitive matching.

business_context.business_definition: Primary high-level reason or category that prompted customer to contact call center
business_context.usage_notes: Top-level categorization. Use TRIM(LOWER()) for matching. Filter out null values. Use GROUP BY for distribution analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Sequence of departments a call was transferred through during the interaction
business_context.data_quality_note: High cardinality - many unique transfer patterns.
business_context.usage_notes: To detect transfers: WHERE departments_transferred IS NOT NULL AND departments_transferred != ''.
business_context.detection_logic: Transferred = NOT NULL AND not empty string. Not Transferred = NULL OR empty string.

business_context.business_definition: Total time spent handling customer call including talk time, hold time, and after-call work measured in seconds
business_context.usage_notes: Divide by 60 to convert to minutes. Filter: WHERE total_call_time > 0 AND total_call_time < 7200 (exclude zeros and outliers).

business_context.business_definition: Date when customer call occurred
business_context.usage_notes: Use for time-based filtering and trending. Primary date field for temporal analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Unique code identifying customer's pricing plan or rate plan
business_context.data_quality_note: High cardinality. Consider grouping into plan categories for analysis.
business_context.usage_notes: Use for pricing/plan segmentation. Use COUNT DISTINCT to understand plan diversity. Do NOT aggregate numerically (codes are categorical).

business_context.business_definition: Category code indicating type of service line
business_context.usage_notes: Use for line type segmentation. Use exact match (case-sensitive).

business_context.business_definition: Unique identifier for customer account
business_context.usage_notes: Primary account identifier for billing and service management.

business_context.business_definition: Service or equipment product type associated with the line
business_context.data_quality_note: High cardinality. Product names include technical specifications.
business_context.usage_notes: Use for service type analysis. Group by keywords for simplified analysis. Do NOT aggregate.

business_context.business_definition: Geographic market or territory identifier where service is provisioned
business_context.data_quality_note: High cardinality. Consider grouping into regions for analysis.
business_context.usage_notes: Use for geographic segmentation. Use exact match for filtering. Do NOT aggregate numerically.

business_context.business_definition: Sequential numeric identifier for individual lines within a customer account
business_context.data_quality_note: Sequential numbering. Used to differentiate multiple lines per customer.
business_context.usage_notes: Use with customer_id to uniquely identify lines. For line counts: COUNT(DISTINCT line_sequence_id) GROUP BY customer_id. Do NOT aggregate as a metric.

business_context.business_definition: Indicates whether a line is currently active, suspended, or terminated
business_context.usage_notes: Filter to active lines for most KPIs. Use exact case matching.

business_context.business_definition: Identifies whether the customer line operates on a prepaid or postpaid billing model
business_context.usage_notes: Use for segmentation in churn and sentiment analysis. Y=Prepaid, N=Postpaid.

business_context.business_definition: Classifies the type of customer device or network technology
business_context.data_quality_note: May contain null values as strings.
business_context.usage_notes: Use for device segmentation. Group by network generation for analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Classifies the type of customer - individual, business, enterprise, etc.
business_context.usage_notes: Use for customer segmentation. Do NOT aggregate.

business_context.business_definition: Identifies the primary reason or intent for the customer call
business_context.usage_notes: Use for grouping and filtering customer call drivers. Do NOT aggregate.

business_context.business_definition: Unique identifier for customer in churn analysis
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for churn metrics. Use COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id) for unique churned customers.

business_context.business_definition: Primary customer identifier in the master customer account table
business_context.usage_notes: CORE join key for all customer analysis. Foundation for customer relationships.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for current price plan assignments
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for active price plans. Use for current plan analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for daily activity tracking
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for daily activity metrics. Use with activity_code for adds/disconnects.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for device purchases and upgrades
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for equipment sales analysis. Use for upgrade tracking.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier linking call center interactions
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for call center metrics. Links to recovery_key and ivr_call_id.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for IVR system interactions
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for IVR analytics. Use for self-service analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for call-level sentiment analysis
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for sentiment analytics. Use for customer experience analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for agent-level sentiment tracking
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for agent performance analytics. Links to agent_id.

business_context.business_definition: Customer identifier for subscription tracking
business_context.usage_notes: Join key for subscriber metrics. Use COUNT(DISTINCT customer_id) for active base.

business_context.business_definition: Customer's mobile telephone number (encrypted/hashed)
business_context.usage_notes: Line-level identifier. Links to customer_id and account_number.

business_context.business_definition: Mobile telephone number for churned line
business_context.usage_notes: Identifies specific line that churned. Use COUNT(DISTINCT phone_number) for line counts.

business_context.business_definition: Count of previous calls made by this customer within the past 3 days
business_context.data_quality_note: Contains extreme outliers. Valid range: 0 to ~100.
business_context.usage_notes: PRIMARY indicator for caller type. Segmentation: WHERE repeat_caller_3day_count = 0 for first-time callers, BETWEEN 1 AND 3 for occasional repeat, > 3 for frequent repeat. Use for first-call resolution analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Secondary level categorization providing detailed breakdown of call intent
business_context.data_quality_note: High cardinality within each L1 category.
business_context.usage_notes: SECONDARY call reason detail. Use with call_driver_l1 for context. Filter out nulls.

business_context.business_definition: Most granular level of call reason, providing specific details about exact issue
business_context.data_quality_note: Very high cardinality. Semantic overlap in values.
business_context.usage_notes: DETAILED call reason. Use for root cause analysis. Always combine with L1 and L2 for context.

business_context.business_definition: Specific reason identified for customer dissatisfaction during call
business_context.usage_notes: Use for negative sentiment root cause. Filter: WHERE customer_upset_reason IS NOT NULL.

business_context.business_definition: Calendar date on which the customer call occurred
business_context.usage_notes: Use for time-based analysis - daily, weekly, monthly trends. Primary date field for temporal queries.

business_context.business_definition: Whether the call was escalated to a supervisor
business_context.usage_notes: Use for escalation analysis. Filter: WHERE escalated_to_supervisor = 'yes'.

business_context.business_definition: Current status of the service line
business_context.usage_notes: Filter to active for KPIs: WHERE line_status = 'Active'.

business_context.business_definition: Total time agent spent handling call including talk, hold, and after-call work
business_context.usage_notes: Key performance metric. Convert to minutes: handle_time_seconds / 60. Use AVG() for agent performance.

business_context.business_definition: Total number of service disconnections
business_context.usage_notes: Primary churn metric. total_disconnects > 0 indicates customer churned.

business_context.business_definition: Customers who actively chose to cancel service
business_context.usage_notes: voluntary_disconnects > 0 indicates active churn by customer choice.

business_context.business_definition: Service terminations by provider (non-payment, policy violations)
business_context.usage_notes: involuntary_disconnects > 0 indicates forced disconnection.

business_context.business_definition: Network technology type of customer device
business_context.usage_notes: Use for technology segmentation and network generation analysis.

business_context.business_definition: Whether retention attempt successfully saved customer
business_context.usage_notes: 1 = customer saved, 0 = not saved. Use SUM() for save counts, AVG() for save rate.

business_context.business_definition: Type of line activity event
business_context.usage_notes: Use for growth/churn analysis. Filter by type for specific metrics.

business_context.business_definition: Whether customer's issue was resolved during the call
business_context.usage_notes: Key quality metric. Use for first-call resolution rate calculation.

business_context.business_definition: Binary indicator if call was answered by agent
business_context.usage_notes: 0 = not answered, 1 = answered. Use SUM() for total answered calls.

business_context.business_definition: Binary indicator if call was abandoned before agent answer
business_context.usage_notes: 0 = not abandoned, 1 = abandoned. Use SUM() for abandonment counts.
